page.title: 07Electricity for Rhenigidale
page.content: In 1980 the North of Scotland Hydro_Electric Board with aid from the EEC provided the village of Rhenigidale with mains electricity. Previously the villagers had used calor gas,tilley lamps and diesel generators for light, heat and cooking. Two of the houses had these generators but they were only used in the evening thus providing, for a short time power points for television lights etc. The mains power line came overland from Maaruig(four miles north of the village). Over 100 poles were erected and they and the cables were flown from Maaruig to their sites by helicopter. All the inhabited houses have electricity and deep freezes, fridges etc.are commonplace. Powercuts do happen but that inconvenience is compensated for by the 'touch of a switch' power now available.
